metadata.Title: CVE-2016-10081 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
/usr/bin/shutter in Shutter through 0.93.1 allows user-assisted remoteattackers to execute arbitrary commands via a crafted image name that ismishandled during a "Run a plugin" action.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-10081` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

shutter - 0.99.2-4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: shutter package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.99.2-4').
